page.title: 20CHANGE: INDUSTRY, GILLINGHAM
page.content: {Industry}has changed a lot since the war. Then, there were three blacksmiths, two glove{factories,}a slaughter house, brewery, a gasworks, a timber yard, a milk factory called United Dairies, Maloney's glue factory and a brickyard, the clay for which was taken from where Lodden Lakes are now. There was also a sheep and cattle market in Station Road. Only the blacksmith, Crocker's, and a glove factory remain, along with the bacon factory, Oakwood's which has been in existance since 1847. These old industries have been replaced by new forms of{employment. }The old Hudson and Martin's Sawmill is now Sherman Chemicals. Gillingham now has two chemical works and a number of engineering factories on the Brick Fields' Estate.
